task.summary: Default task
Fixed broken test-parse-command
stateless tests working, ready to integrate with listen
All tests up again. Open issue: stateless gets stuck on reading command from itself
Hunting stuck stateless. * make mbean an atom iso ref to coordinate access * logging in find-my-index (which is never called)
Sessions now see each other. TODO: reactivate housekeeping
Housekeeping works now. One small drawback: each session receives its own commands and maintains state for this session.
documented gaps and known defects
Temp fix - replace pipeline with go-loop to filter messages in stateless session Corrected norm jar version number.
TODO removed - added unit tests for pipeline.
Small housekeeping session Documentation extended - new architecture picture added kibit issues solved
Refactored init-logging to util
Code inspector results (partly) fixed
Documentation amended
Message block management now in a transducer
message parsing completed
Receiver working again after message building has been reworked into a transducer.
Race condition in receiver test fixed
Found a more reliable solution to fix the race condition
Two senders now works.
File output now works (but the final messages seem to get stuck between message-rebuilder and output)
File output now works (but the final messages seem to get stuck between message-rebuilder and output)
Receiver interface cleanup
Test coverage increased
Message filtering now with a composed transducer. Message rebuild and filtering now part of the msg channel
Send and receive buffers are now linked in size. The receive buffer is twice as big as the send buffer to ensure that it can consume the incoming traffic. The sender always uses congestion control
Receive buffer size is now dynamically configured. This is achieved by using the get-size result for the input stream and the dependency on sender in receiver could be removed
Message mit Receive-Timestamp. Message-Filter wieder eingebaut. Listen: output-to-file funktioniert jetzt
Fixed message header parsing error. Cause: Header was parsed from the beginning of the buffer.

Fixed race condition in receiver causing broken messages. Reading the NORM buffer was a go-loop inside a go-loop which could lead to two async-threads running at the same time and reading the NORM buffer.
Channel sizes increased. async channels are statically sized. When they are too small the system appearently blocks or loses data.
Optimized logging

Sender shutdown works. Exit of sender loop is now synchronised with the caller and closing stream and session gets through to the receiver. Once I get rid of this stupid sleep(500) I will be really happy with this code.
Tests are now working
Cleaned up imports and unused stuff.
Add NORM license
Shortened version of sender closing as suggested by Brian Adamson
SegFault behoben
Introduced message sequence number to message header. msg-test is green
All tests green
Join command implemented and tested. Pending: Join handling in stateless
Join handling complete, all current tests pass
Filters are now working. Also stateless is now back in service and joining works.

Join part 1 completed * presence and join cmd messages are posted * presence and join cmd messages are received * join seq no now implemented as a transducer (saves one thread per session Pending: * gnothi seauton is next * processing join command is next next
Join part 2 completed: * Gnothi seauton now works. Node identification via node id which must be unique within a session anyway. Pending: * Sessions expire too early.

Session expiry issue fixed. I-am-alive was sent as commands with the "robust" parameter set to true which meant that NORM was sending the command 20 times to be sure all receivers have received it (no flow control or NAK on commands). Setting "robust" to false solved the problem and occasional command loss is acceptable because the stateless timeouts are sufficiently. They just could not deal with a 500ms delay between commands where 100ms was expected.
Fixed crash in stateless receiver at end of transmission. JVM really crashed because the stream handle was closed and receive data was still reading. Now we retain and release it
Fixed broken unit tests and kibit findings
Join after timeout implemented and tested
Gnothi seauton finally solved. Node-id is computed from the last two bytes of the interface IP address and the process id.

MESSAGE.value: Fixed message header parsing error. Cause: Header was parsed from the beginning of the buffer.

Fixed race condition in receiver causing broken messages. Reading the NORM buffer was a go-loop inside a go-loop which could lead to two async-threads running at the same time and reading the NORM buffer.
Channel sizes increased. async channels are statically sized. When they are too small the system appearently blocks or loses data.
Optimized logging

Sender shutdown works. Exit of sender loop is now synchronised with the caller and closing stream and session gets through to the receiver. Once I get rid of this stupid sleep(500) I will be really happy with this code.
Tests are now working
Cleaned up imports and unused stuff.
Add NORM license
Shortened version of sender closing as suggested by Brian Adamson
SegFault behoben
Some reformatting for canocical placement of parens
Some reformatting for canocical placement of parens. Plus: warnings cleaned up
Introduced message sequence number to message header. msg-test is green
All tests green
Join command implemented and tested. Pending: Join handling in stateless
Join handling complete, all current tests pass
Filters are now working. Also stateless is now back in service and joining works.

Merge branch 'privat-message-sequence'
# Conflicts: # .idea/workspace.xml # src/com/senacor/msm/core/stateless.clj

Join part 1 completed * presence and join cmd messages are posted * presence and join cmd messages are received * join seq no now implemented as a transducer (saves one thread per session Pending: * gnothi seauton is next * processing join command is next next
Join part 2 completed: * Gnothi seauton now works. Node identification via node id which must be unique within a session anyway. Pending: * Sessions expire too early.

Session expiry issue fixed. I-am-alive was sent as commands with the "robust" parameter set to true which meant that NORM was sending the command 20 times to be sure all receivers have received it (no flow control or NAK on commands). Setting "robust" to false solved the problem and occasional command loss is acceptable because the stateless timeouts are sufficiently. They just could not deal with a 500ms delay between commands where 100ms was expected.
Fixed crash in stateless receiver at end of transmission. JVM really crashed because the stream handle was closed and receive data was still reading. Now we retain and release it
Fixed broken unit tests and kibit findings
Join after timeout implemented and tested
Gnothi seauton finally solved. Node-id is computed from the last two bytes of the interface IP address and the process id.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Gnothi seauton finally solved. Node-id is computed from the last two bytes of the interface IP address and the process id.
